inventory.commentary: 4oct06 update to wn.2.1, added features. ahouston

sense.name: a distinct happening, an instance of an event, occurrence
sense.commentary: INCIDENT[+event][+happening][+distinct][+instance] a single distinct event Note: does not imply a negative or disruptive occurrence (Sense 2)
sense.examples: At dinner he related some amusing incidents from his trip to London. In five years there was only one incident when John was late to an appointment. I can't recall any other incidents of seeing that man in front of our house.

sense.name: a public disturbance, an upheaval
sense.commentary: INCIDENT[+event][+happening][+social][+disturbance][+public] Note: always implies a grave, violent or otherwise disruptive, event. Note: a restricted usage of Sense 1, always with a negative implication
sense.examples: The plane lost power in one engine, but returned to the airport without incident. The police investigated a stabbing incident at the bus station. There have been several incidents of joggers being mugged in the park. The shooting of patrol guard constituted a serious border incident between the countries.
